types.name: Artifact
types.description:
Artifact represents an artifact identified by a checksum hash.

The checksum is split into the digest value and the algorithm used to generate
it. Both fields are mandatory and canonicalized to be lowercase.

If having a checksum Go object, algorithm can be
strings.ToLower(string(checksum.Algorithm)) and digest can be checksum.Value.

types.name: ArtifactConnection
types.description:
ArtifactConnection returns the paginated results for artifact.

totalCount is the total number of results returned.

pageInfo provides information to the client if there is
a next page of results and the starting and
ending cursor for the current set.

edges contains the ArtifactEdge which contains the current cursor
and the artifact node itself

types.name: ArtifactEdge
types.description:
ArtifactEdge contains the cursor for the resulting node and
the artifact node itself.

types.name: ArtifactInputSpec
types.description:
ArtifactInputSpec specifies an artifact for mutations.

The checksum fields are canonicalized to be lowercase.

types.name: ArtifactSpec
types.description:
ArtifactSpec allows filtering the list of artifacts to return in a query.

The checksum fields are canonicalized to be lowercase.

types.name: Boolean
types.description: The `Boolean` scalar type represents `true` or `false`.

types.name: Builder
types.description:
Builder represents the builder (e.g., FRSCA or GitHub Actions).

Currently builders are identified by the uri field.

types.name: BuilderConnection
types.description:
BuilderConnection returns the paginated results for builder.

totalCount is the total number of results returned.

pageInfo provides information to the client if there is
a next page of results and the starting and
ending cursor for the current set.

edges contains the BuilderEdge which contains the current cursor
and the Builder node itself

types.name: BuilderEdge
types.description:
BuilderEdge contains the cursor for the resulting node and
the Builder node itself.

types.name: BuilderInputSpec
types.description: BuilderInputSpec specifies a builder for mutations.

types.name: BuilderSpec
types.description: BuilderSpec allows filtering the list of builders to return in a query.

types.name: CertifyBad
types.description:
CertifyBad is an attestation that a package, source, or artifact is considered
bad.

All evidence trees record a justification for the property they represent as
well as the document that contains the attestation (origin) and the collector
that collected the document (collector).

The certification applies to a subject which is a package, source, or artifact.
If the attestation targets a package, it must target a PackageName or a
PackageVersion. If the attestation targets a source, it must target a
SourceName.

fields.name: subject
fields.description: The package, source or artifact that is attested

fields.name: justification
fields.description: The justification for the subject being certified bad

fields.name: knownSince
fields.description: Timestamp when the certification was created (in RFC 3339 format)

fields.name: origin
fields.description: Document from which this attestation is generated from

fields.name: collector
fields.description: GUAC collector for the document

fields.name: documentRef
fields.description: Reference location of the document in the persistent blob store (if that is configured)

types.name: CertifyBadConnection
types.description:
CertifyBadConnection returns the paginated results for CertifyBad.

totalCount is the total number of results returned.

pageInfo provides information to the client if there is
a next page of results and the starting and
ending cursor for the current set.

edges contains the CertifyBadEdge which contains the current cursor
and the CertifyBad node itself

types.name: CertifyBadEdge
types.description:
CertifyBadEdge contains the cursor for the resulting node and
the CertifyBad node itself.

types.name: CertifyBadInputSpec
types.description:
CertifyBadInputSpec represents the mutation input to ingest a CertifyBad
evidence.

types.name: CertifyBadSpec
types.description:
CertifyBadSpec allows filtering the list of CertifyBad evidence to return in a
query.

If a package is specified in the subject filter, then it must be specified up
to PackageName or PackageVersion. That is, user must specify package name, or
name and one of version, qualifiers, or subpath.

If a source is specified in the subject filter, then it must specify a name,
and optionally a tag and a commit.

If KnownSince is specified, the returned value will be after or equal to the specified time.
Any nodes time that is before KnownSince is excluded.

types.name: CertifyGood
types.description:
CertifyGood is an attestation that a package, source, or artifact is considered
good.

All evidence trees record a justification for the property they represent as
well as the document that contains the attestation (origin) and the collector
that collected the document (collector).

The certification applies to a subject which is a package, source, or artifact.
If the attestation targets a package, it must target a PackageName or a
PackageVersion. If the attestation targets a source, it must target a
SourceName.

fields.name: subject
fields.description: The package, source or artifact that is attested

fields.name: justification
fields.description: The justification for the subject being certified good

fields.name: knownSince
fields.description: Timestamp when the certification was created (in RFC 3339 format)

fields.name: origin
fields.description: Document from which this attestation is generated from

fields.name: collector
fields.description: GUAC collector for the document

fields.name: documentRef
fields.description: Reference location of the document in the persistent blob store (if that is configured)

types.name: CertifyGoodConnection
types.description:
CertifyGoodConnection returns the paginated results for CertifyGood.

totalCount is the total number of results returned.

pageInfo provides information to the client if there is
a next page of results and the starting and
ending cursor for the current set.

edges contains the CertifyGoodEdge which contains the current cursor
and the CertifyGood node itself

types.name: CertifyGoodEdge
types.description:
CertifyGoodEdge contains the cursor for the resulting node and
the CertifyGood node itself.

types.name: CertifyGoodInputSpec
types.description: CertifyGoodInputSpec represents the mutation input to ingest a CertifyGood evidence.

types.name: CertifyGoodSpec
types.description:
CertifyBadSpec allows filtering the list of CertifyBad evidence to return in a
query.

If a package is specified in the subject filter, then it must be specified up
to PackageName or PackageVersion. That is, user must specify package name, or
name and one of version, qualifiers, or subpath.

If a source is specified in the subject filter, then it must specify a name,
and optionally a tag and a commit.

If KnownSince is specified, the returned value will be after or equal to the specified time.
Any nodes time that is before KnownSince is excluded.

types.name: CertifyLegal
types.description:
CertifyLegal is an attestation to attach legal information to a package or source.

The certification information is either copied from an attestation found in an
SBOM or created by a collector/scanner.

Discovered license is also known as Concluded. More information:
https://docs.clearlydefined.io/curation-guidelines#the-difference-between-declared-and-discovered-licenses

Attribution is also known as Copyright Text. It is what could be displayed to
comply with notice
requirements. https://www.nexb.com/oss-attribution-best-practices/

License expressions follow this format:
https://spdx.github.io/spdx-spec/v2.3/SPDX-license-expressions/

fields.name: subject
fields.description: The package version or source that is attested

fields.name: declaredLicense
fields.description: The license expression as delcared

fields.name: declaredLicenses
fields.description: A list of license objects found in the declared license expression

fields.name: discoveredLicense
fields.description: The license expression as discovered by scan

fields.name: discoveredLicenses
fields.description: A list of license objects found in the discovered license expression

fields.name: attribution
fields.description: Attribution text of the subject

fields.name: justification
fields.description: Extra justification for the certification

fields.name: timeScanned
fields.description: Time of scan (in RFC 3339 format)

fields.name: origin
fields.description: Document from which this attestation is generated from

fields.name: collector
fields.description: GUAC collector for the document

fields.name: documentRef
fields.description: Reference location of the document in the persistent blob store (if that is configured)

types.name: CertifyLegalConnection
types.description:
CertifyLegalConnection returns the paginated results for CertifyLegal.

totalCount is the total number of results returned.

pageInfo provides information to the client if there is
a next page of results and the starting and
ending cursor for the current set.

edges contains the CertifyLegalEdge which contains the current cursor
and the CertifyLegal node itself

types.name: CertifyLegalEdge
types.description:
CertifyLegalEdge contains the cursor for the resulting node and
the CertifyLegal node itself.

types.name: CertifyLegalInputSpec
types.description:
CertifyLegalInputSpec represents the input for certifying legal information in
mutations.

types.name: CertifyLegalSpec
types.description:
CertifyLegalSpec allows filtering the list of legal certifications to
return in a query.

Specifying just the package allows to query for all certifications associated
with the package.

types.name: CertifyScorecard
types.description:
CertifyScorecard is an attestation to attach a Scorecard analysis to a
particular source repository.

fields.name: source
fields.description: The source repository that is being scanned (attestation subject)

fields.name: scorecard
fields.description: The Scorecard attached to the repository (attestation object)

types.name: CertifyScorecardConnection
types.description:
CertifyScorecardConnection returns the paginated results for CertifyScorecard.

totalCount is the total number of results returned.

pageInfo provides information to the client if there is
a next page of results and the starting and
ending cursor for the current set.

edges contains the CertifyScorecardEdge which contains the current cursor
and the CertifyScorecard node itself

types.name: CertifyScorecardEdge
types.description:
CertifyScorecardEdge contains the cursor for the resulting node and
the CertifyScorecard node itself.

types.name: CertifyScorecardSpec
types.description: CertifyScorecardSpec allows filtering the list of Scorecards to return.

types.name: CertifyVEXStatement
types.description:
CertifyVEXStatement is an attestation to attach VEX statements to a package or
artifact to clarify the impact of a specific vulnerability.

fields.name: subject
fields.description: Subject of attestation

fields.name: vulnerability
fields.description: Attested vulnerability

fields.name: status
fields.description: Status of the vulnerabilities with respect to the subject

fields.name: vexJustification
fields.description: Justification from VEX statement

fields.name: statement
fields.description: VEX statement: impact_statement or action_statement depending on status

fields.name: statusNotes
fields.description: statusNotes may convey information about how status was determined

fields.name: knownSince
fields.description: Timestamp (exact time in RFC 3339 format) for the VEX statement

fields.name: origin
fields.description: Document from which this attestation is generated from

fields.name: collector
fields.description: GUAC collector for the document

fields.name: documentRef
fields.description: Reference location of the document in the persistent blob store (if that is configured)

types.name: CertifyVEXStatementSpec
types.description:
CertifyVEXStatementSpec allows filtering the list of VEX statements to
return in a query.

Only one subject type (package or artifact) and one vulnerability may be specified.

Note that setting noVuln vulnerability type is invalid for VEX statements!

types.name: CertifyVuln
types.description:
CertifyVuln is an attestation to attach vulnerability information to a package.

This information is obtained via a scanner. If there is no vulnerability
detected, we attach the a vulnerability with "NoVuln" type and an empty string
for the vulnerability ID.

fields.name: package
fields.description: The package that is attested

fields.name: vulnerability
fields.description: The vulnerability can be an be a specific vulnerability or NoVuln type.

fields.name: metadata
fields.description: Metadata attached to the certification

types.name: CertifyVulnConnection
types.description:
CertifyVulnConnection returns the paginated results for CertifyVuln.

totalCount is the total number of results returned.

pageInfo provides information to the client if there is
a next page of results and the starting and
ending cursor for the current set.

edges contains the CertifyVulnEdge which contains the current cursor
and the CertifyVuln node itself

types.name: CertifyVulnEdge
types.description:
CertifyVulnEdge contains the cursor for the resulting node and
the CertifyVuln node itself.

types.name: CertifyVulnOrCertifyVEXStatement
types.description: CertifyVulnOrCertifyVEXStatement is a union of CertifyVuln and CertifyVEXStatement.

types.name: CertifyVulnSpec
types.description:
CertifyVulnSpec allows filtering the list of vulnerability certifications to
return in a query.

Specifying just the package allows to query for all vulnerabilities associated
with the package.

Only one vulnerability (or NoVuln vulnerability type) may be
specified.

types.name: Comparator
types.description: The Comparator is used by the vulnerability score filter on ranges

types.name: DependencyType
types.description: DependencyType determines the type of the dependency.

types.name: Edge
types.description:
Edge allows filtering path/neighbors output to only contain a subset of all
possible GUAC links.

Each member of the enum is formed by merging two Node names with _. Each name
is converted from CamelCase to CAPITALS_WITH_UNDERSCORES. Only valid edges
(pairs from Node to Node) are included. Edges are defined in both directions,
which means nodes can be traversed from either direction.

The only exception to the above rule is for links out of HasSLSA. The names are
HAS_SLSA_SUBJECT, HAS_SLSA_BUILT_BY, and HAS_SLSA_MATERIALS. This is because
ARTIFACT_HAS_SLSA is only from subject Artifact to HasSLSA.

types.name: FindSoftwareConnection
types.description:
FindSoftwareConnection returns the paginated results for FindSoftware.

totalCount is the total number of results returned.

pageInfo provides information to the client if there is
a next page of results and the starting and
ending cursor for the current set.

edges contains the SoftwareEdge which contains the current cursor
and the PackageSourceOrArtifact node itself

types.name: Float
types.description: The `Float` scalar type represents signed double-precision fractional values as specified by [IEEE 754](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/IEEE_floating_point).

types.name: HasMetadata
types.description:
HasMetadata is an attestation that a package, source, or artifact has a certain
attested property (key) with value (value). For example, a source may have
metadata "SourceRepo2FAEnabled=true".

The intent of this evidence tree predicate is to allow extensibility of metadata
expressible within the GUAC ontology. Metadata that is commonly used will then
be promoted to a predicate on its own.

Justification indicates how the metadata was determined.

The metadata applies to a subject which is a package, source, or artifact.
If the attestation targets a package, it must target a PackageName or a
PackageVersion. If the attestation targets a source, it must target a
SourceName.

fields.name: subject
fields.description: The package, source or artifact that is attested

fields.name: key
fields.description: Key in the key value pair

fields.name: value
fields.description: Value in the key value pair

fields.name: timestamp
fields.description: Timestamp when the certification was created (in RFC 3339 format)

fields.name: justification
fields.description: The justification for the metadata

fields.name: origin
fields.description: Document from which this attestation is generated from

fields.name: collector
fields.description: GUAC collector for the document

fields.name: documentRef
fields.description: Reference location of the document in the persistent blob store (if that is configured)

types.name: HasMetadataConnection
types.description:
HasMetadataConnection returns the paginated results for HasMetadata.

totalCount is the total number of results returned.

pageInfo provides information to the client if there is
a next page of results and the starting and
ending cursor for the current set.

edges contains the HasMetadataEdge which contains the current cursor
and the HasMetadata node itself

types.name: HasMetadataEdge
types.description:
HasMetadataEdge contains the cursor for the resulting node and
the HasMetadata node itself.

types.name: HasMetadataInputSpec
types.description: HasMetadataInputSpec represents the mutation input to ingest a CertifyGood evidence.

types.name: HasMetadataSpec
types.description:
HasMetadataSpec allows filtering the list of HasMetadata evidence to return in a
query.

If a package is specified in the subject filter, then it must be specified up
to PackageName or PackageVersion. That is, user must specify package name, or
name and one of version, qualifiers, or subpath.

If a source is specified in the subject filter, then it must specify a name,
and optionally a tag and a commit.

since specified indicates filtering timestamps after the specified time

fields.name: subject
fields.description: SBOM subject

fields.name: uri
fields.description: Identifier for the SBOM document

fields.name: algorithm
fields.description: Algorithm by which SBOMs digest was computed

fields.name: digest
fields.description: Digest of SBOM

fields.name: downloadLocation
fields.description: Location from which the SBOM can be downloaded

fields.name: knownSince
fields.description: Timestamp for SBOM creation

fields.name: origin
fields.description: Document from which this attestation is generated from

fields.name: collector
fields.description: GUAC collector for the document

fields.name: documentRef
fields.description: Reference location of the document in the persistent blob store (if that is configured)

fields.name: includedSoftware
fields.description: Included packages and artifacts

fields.name: includedDependencies
fields.description: Included dependencies

fields.name: includedOccurrences
fields.description: Included occurrences

Only the package or artifact can be added, not both.

If KnownSince is specified, the returned value will be after or equal to the specified time.
Any nodes time that is before KnownSince is excluded.

types.description: HashEqual is an attestation that two artifacts are identical.

fields.name: artifacts
fields.description: Two artifacts that are similar

fields.name: justification
fields.description: Justification for the claim that the artifacts are similar

fields.name: origin
fields.description: Document from which this attestation is generated from

fields.name: collector
fields.description: GUAC collector for the document

fields.name: documentRef
fields.description: Reference location of the document in the persistent blob store (if that is configured)

types.name: HashEqualConnection
types.description:
HashEqualConnection returns the paginated results for HashEqual.

totalCount is the total number of results returned.

pageInfo provides information to the client if there is
a next page of results and the starting and
ending cursor for the current set.

edges contains the HashEqualEdge which contains the current cursor
and the HashEqual node itself

types.name: HashEqualEdge
types.description:
HashEqualEdge contains the cursor for the resulting node and

types.name: ID
types.description: The `ID` scalar type represents a unique identifier, often used to refetch an object or as key for a cache. The ID type appears in a JSON response as a String; however, it is not intended to be human-readable. When expected as an input type, any string (such as "4") or integer (such as 4) input value will be accepted as an ID.

types.name: IDorArtifactInput
types.description:
IDorArtifactInput allows for specifying either the artifact ID or the ArtifactInputSpec.

Either the ID or the ArtifactInputSpec must be specified. Both cannot be nil.

If the ID is specified, the ArtifactInputSpec is not used.

types.name: IDorBuilderInput
types.description:
IDorBuilderInput allows for specifying either the builder ID or the BuilderInputSpec.

Either the ID or the BuilderInputSpec must be specified. Both cannot be nil.

If the ID is specified, the BuilderInputSpec is not used.

types.name: IDorLicenseInput
types.description:
IDorLicenseInput allows for specifying either the license ID or the LicenseInputSpec.

Either the ID or the LicenseInputSpec must be specified. Both cannot be nil.

If the ID is specified, the LicenseInputSpec is not used.

types.name: IDorPkgInput
types.description:
IDorPkgInput allows for specifying either the package IDs or the PkgInputSpec.

Either the IDs or the PkgInputSpec must be specified. Both cannot be nil.

If the IDs are specified, the PkgInputSpec is not used.

types.name: IDorSourceInput
types.description:
IDorSourceInput allows for specifying either the source IDs or the SourceInputSpec.

Either the IDs or the SourceInputSpec must be specified. Both cannot be nil.

If the IDs are specified, the SourceInputSpec is not used.

types.name: IDorVulnerabilityInput
types.description:
IDorVulnerabilityInput allows for specifying either the vulnerability IDs or the VulnerabilityInputSpec.

Either the IDs or the VulnerabilityInputSpec must be specified. Both cannot be nil.

If the IDs are specified, the VulnerabilityInputSpec is not used.

types.name: Int
types.description: The `Int` scalar type represents non-fractional signed whole numeric values. Int can represent values between -(2^31) and 2^31 - 1.

types.name: IsDependency
types.description: IsDependency is an attestation to record that a package depends on another.

fields.name: package
fields.description: Package that has the dependency

fields.name: dependencyPackage
fields.description: Package for the dependency; MUST be PackageName or PackageVersion

fields.name: versionRange
fields.description: Version range for the dependency link, required if depedentPackage points to PackageName

fields.name: dependencyType
fields.description: Type of dependency

fields.name: justification
fields.description: Justification for the attested relationship

fields.name: origin
fields.description: Document from which this attestation is generated from

fields.name: collector
fields.description: GUAC collector for the document

fields.name: documentRef
fields.description: Reference location of the document in the persistent blob store (if that is configured)

types.description:
IsDependencyConnection returns the paginated results for IsDependency.

and the IsDependency node itself

IsDependencyEdge contains the cursor for the resulting node and
the IsDependency node itself.

types.name: IsDependencyInputSpec
types.description: IsDependencyInputSpec is the input to record a new dependency.

inputFields.name: versionRange
inputFields.description: versionRange should be specified for depedentPackages that point to PackageName

types.name: IsDependencySpec
types.description:
IsDependencySpec allows filtering the list of dependencies to return.

To obtain the list of dependency packages, caller must fill in the package
field.

Dependency packages must be defined at PackageName, not PackageVersion.

types.name: IsOccurrence
types.description:
IsOccurrence is an attestation to link an artifact to a package or source.

Attestation must occur at the PackageVersion or at the SourceName.

fields.name: artifact
fields.description: The artifact in the relationship

fields.name: justification
fields.description: Justification for the attested relationship

fields.name: origin
fields.description: Document from which this attestation is generated from

fields.name: collector
fields.description: GUAC collector for the document

fields.name: documentRef
fields.description: Reference location of the document in the persistent blob store (if that is configured)

IsOccurrenceConnection returns the paginated results for IsOccurrence.

types.name: IsOccurrenceInputSpec
types.description: IsOccurrenceInputSpec represents the input to record an artifact's origin.

types.name: IsOccurrenceSpec

IsOccurrenceSpec allows filtering the list of artifact occurences to return in
a query.

types.name: License
types.description:
License represents a particular license. If the license is found on the SPDX
license list (https://spdx.org/licenses/) then the fields should be:

Name: SPDX license identifier
Inline: empty
ListVersion: SPDX license list version

example:

Name: AGPL-3.0-or-later
Inline: ""
ListVersion: 3.21 2023-06-18

If the license is not on the SPDX license list, then a new guid should be
created and the license text placed inline:

Name: LicenseRef-<guid>
Inline: Full license text
ListVersion: empty

example:

Name: LicenseRef-1a2b3c
Inline: Permission to use, copy, modify, and/or distribute ...
ListVersion: ""

types.name: LicenseConnection
types.description:
LicenseConnection returns the paginated results for License.

totalCount is the total number of results returned.

pageInfo provides information to the client if there is
a next page of results and the starting and
ending cursor for the current set.

edges contains the LicenseEdge which contains the current cursor
and the License node itself

types.name: LicenseEdge
types.description:
LicenseEdge contains the cursor for the resulting node and
the License node itself.

types.name: LicenseInputSpec
types.description:
LicenseInputSpec specifies an license for mutations. One of inline or
listVersion should be empty or missing.

types.name: LicenseSpec
types.description: LicenseSpec allows filtering the list of licenses to return in a query.

types.name: MatchFlags
types.description: MatchFlags is used to input the PkgMatchType enum.

fields.name: ingestArtifact
fields.description: Ingests a new artifact and returns it.

fields.name: ingestArtifacts
fields.description: Bulk ingests new artifacts and returns a list of them. The returned array of IDs must be in the same order as the inputs.

fields.name: ingestBuilder
fields.description: Ingests a new builder and returns it.

fields.name: ingestBuilders
fields.description: Bulk ingests new builders and returns a list of them. The returned array of IDs must be in the same order as the inputs.

fields.name: ingestCertifyBad
fields.description: Adds a certification that a package, source or artifact is considered bad. The returned ID can be empty string.

fields.name: ingestCertifyBads
fields.description: Adds bulk certifications that a package, source or artifact is considered bad. The returned array of IDs can be a an array of empty string.

fields.name: ingestCertifyGood
fields.description: Adds a certification that a package, source or artifact is considered good. The returned ID can be empty string.

fields.name: ingestCertifyGoods
fields.description: Adds bulk certifications that a package, source or artifact is considered good. The returned array of IDs can be a an array of empty string.

fields.name: ingestCertifyLegal
fields.description: Adds a legal certification to a package or source.

fields.name: ingestCertifyLegals
fields.description: Bulk add legal certifications to packages or sources, not both at same time.

fields.name: ingestScorecard
fields.description: Adds a certification that a source repository has a Scorecard. The returned ID can be empty string.

fields.name: ingestScorecards
fields.description: Adds bulk certifications that a source repository has a Scorecard. The returned array of IDs can be a an array of empty string.

fields.name: ingestVEXStatement
fields.description: Adds a VEX certification for a package. The returned ID can be empty string.

fields.name: ingestVEXStatements
fields.description: Bulk add VEX certifications for a package and vulnerability. The returned array of IDs can be a an array of empty string.

fields.name: ingestCertifyVuln
fields.description: Adds a certification that a package has been scanned for vulnerabilities. The returned ID can be empty string.

fields.name: ingestCertifyVulns
fields.description: Bulk add certifications that a package has been scanned for vulnerabilities. The returned array of IDs can be a an array of empty string.

fields.name: ingestPointOfContact
fields.description: Adds a PointOfContact attestation to a package, source or artifact. The returned ID can be empty string.

fields.name: ingestPointOfContacts
fields.description: Adds bulk PointOfContact attestations to a package, source or artifact. The returned array of IDs can be a an array of empty string.

fields.name: ingestHasSBOM
fields.description: Certifies that a package or artifact has an SBOM. The returned ID can be empty string.

fields.name: ingestHasSBOMs
fields.description: Bulk ingest that package or artifact has an SBOM. The returned array of IDs can be a an array of empty string.

fields.name: ingestSLSA
fields.description: Ingests a SLSA attestation. The returned ID can be empty string.

fields.name: ingestSLSAs
fields.description: Bulk Ingest SLSA attestations. The returned array of IDs can be a an array of empty string.

fields.name: ingestHasSourceAt
fields.description: Adds a certification that a package (PackageName or PackageVersion) is built from the source. The returned ID can be empty string.

fields.name: ingestHasSourceAts
fields.description: Bulk ingestion of certifications that a package (PackageName or PackageVersion) is built from the source. The returned array of IDs can be a an array of empty string.

fields.name: ingestHashEqual
fields.description: Adds a certification that two artifacts are equal. The returned ID can be empty string.

fields.name: ingestHashEquals
fields.description: Bulk ingest certifications that two artifacts are equal. The returned array of IDs can be a an array of empty string.

fields.name: ingestDependency
fields.description: Adds a dependency between two packages. The returned ID cannot be empty string as its used by hasSBOM.

fields.name: ingestDependencies
fields.description: Bulk adds a dependency between two packages. The returned array of IDs cannot be an empty string as its used by hasSBOM.

fields.name: ingestOccurrence
fields.description: Ingest that an artifact is produced from a package or source. The returned ID cannot be empty string as its used by hasSBOM.

fields.name: ingestOccurrences
fields.description: Bulk ingest that an artifact is produced from a package or source. The returned array of IDs cannot be an empty string as its used by hasSBOM

fields.name: ingestLicense
fields.description: Ingests a new license and returns it.

fields.name: ingestLicenses
fields.description: Bulk ingests new licenses and returns a list of them. The returned array of IDs must be in the same order as the inputs.

fields.name: ingestHasMetadata
fields.description: Adds metadata about a package, source or artifact. The returned ID can be empty string.

fields.name: ingestBulkHasMetadata
fields.description: Adds bulk metadata about a package, source or artifact. The returned array of IDs can be a an array of empty string.

fields.name: ingestPackage
fields.description: Ingests a new package and returns a corresponding package hierarchy containing only the IDs.

fields.name: ingestPackages
fields.description: Bulk ingests packages and returns the list of corresponding package hierarchies containing only the IDs. The returned array of IDs must be in the same order as the inputs.

fields.name: ingestPkgEqual
fields.description: Adds a certification that two packages are similar. The returned ID can be empty string.

fields.name: ingestPkgEquals
fields.description: Bulk ingest mapping between packages. The returned array of IDs can be a an array of empty string.

fields.name: ingestSource
fields.description: Ingests a new source and returns the corresponding source trie path.

fields.name: ingestSources
fields.description: Bulk ingests sources and returns the list of corresponding source trie path. The returned array of IDs must be in the same order as the inputs.

fields.name: ingestVulnEqual
fields.description: Ingest a mapping between vulnerabilities. The returned ID can be empty string.

fields.name: ingestVulnEquals
fields.description: Bulk ingest mapping between vulnerabilities. The returned array of IDs can be a an array of empty string.

fields.name: ingestVulnerabilityMetadata
fields.description: Adds metadata about a vulnerability. The returned ID can be empty string.

fields.name: ingestBulkVulnerabilityMetadata
fields.description: Bulk add certifications that vulnerability has a specific score. The returned array of IDs can be a an array of empty string.

fields.name: ingestVulnerability
fields.description: Ingests a new vulnerability and returns the corresponding vulnerability trie path.

fields.name: ingestVulnerabilities
fields.description: Bulk ingests vulnerabilities and returns the list of corresponding vulnerability trie path. The returned array of IDs must be in the same order as the inputs

types.name: NeighborConnection
types.description:
NeighborConnection returns the paginated results for Neighbor.

totalCount is the total number of results returned.

pageInfo provides information to the client if there is
a next page of results and the starting and
ending cursor for the current set.

edges contains the NeighborEdge which contains the current cursor
and the node itself

types.name: NeighborEdge
types.description:
NeighborEdge contains the cursor for the resulting node and
the node itself.

types.name: Node
types.description:
Node is a union type of all the possible nodes.

It encapsulates the software tree nodes along with the evidence nodes. In a
path query, all connecting evidence nodes along with their intermediate subject
nodes need to be returned in order to create a complete graph.

types.name: Package
types.description:
Package represents the root of the package trie/tree.

We map package information to a trie, closely matching the pURL specification
(https://github.com/package-url/purl-spec/blob/0dd92f26f8bb11956ffdf5e8acfcee71e8560407/README.rst),
but deviating from it where GUAC heuristics allow for better representation of
package information. Each path in the trie fully represents a package; we split
the trie based on the pURL components.

This node matches a pkg:<type> partial pURL. The type field matches the
pURL types but we might also use "guac" for the cases where the pURL
representation is not complete or when we have custom rules.

Since this node is at the root of the package trie, it is named Package, not
PackageType.

types.name: PackageConnection
types.description:
PackageConnection returns the paginated results for Package.

totalCount is the total number of results returned.

pageInfo provides information to the client if there is
a next page of results and the starting and
ending cursor for the current set.

edges contains the PackageEdge which contains the current cursor
and the Package node itself

types.name: PackageEdge
types.description:
PackageEdge contains the cursor for the resulting node and
the Package node itself.

types.name: PackageIDs
types.description: The IDs of the ingested package

types.name: PackageName
types.description:
PackageName is a name for packages.

In the pURL representation, each PackageName matches the
pkg:<type>/<namespace>/<name> pURL.

Names are always mandatory.

This is the first node in the trie that can be referred to by other parts of
GUAC.

types.name: PackageNamespace
types.description:
PackageNamespace is a namespace for packages.

In the pURL representation, each PackageNamespace matches the
pkg:<type>/<namespace>/ partial pURL.

Namespaces are optional and type specific. Because they are optional, we use
empty string to denote missing namespaces.

types.name: PackageOrArtifact
types.description: PackageOrArtifact is a union of Package and Artifact.

types.name: PackageOrArtifactInput
types.description:
PackageOrArtifactInput allows using PackageOrArtifact union as
input type to be used in mutations.

Exactly one of the value must be set to non-nil.

types.name: PackageOrArtifactInputs
types.description:
PackageOrArtifactInputs allows using packages and artifacts as input for batch mutations.
Exactly one list must be specified.

types.name: PackageOrArtifactSpec
types.description:
PackageOrArtifactSpec allows using PackageOrArtifact union as
input type to be used in read queries.

Exactly one of the value must be set to non-nil.

types.name: PackageOrSource
types.description: PackageOrSource is a union of Package and Source.

types.name: PackageOrSourceInput
types.description:
PackageOrSourceInput allows using PackageOrSource union as input for mutations.

Exactly one field must be specified.

types.name: PackageOrSourceInputs
types.description:
PackageOrSourceInputs allows using packages and sources as input for batch mutations.
Exactly one list must be specified.

types.name: PackageOrSourceSpec
types.description:
PackageOrSourceSpec allows using PackageOrSource union as input for queries.

Exactly one field must be specified.

types.name: PackageQualifier
types.description:
PackageQualifier is a qualifier for a package, a key-value pair.

In the pURL representation, it is a part of the <qualifiers> part of the
pkg:<type>/<namespace>/<name>@<version>?<qualifiers> pURL.

Qualifiers are optional, each Package type defines own rules for handling them,
and multiple qualifiers could be attached to the same package.

This node cannot be directly referred by other parts of GUAC.

types.name: PackageQualifierInputSpec
types.description: PackageQualifierInputSpec allows specifying package qualifiers in mutations.

types.name: PackageQualifierSpec
types.description:
PackageQualifierSpec allows filtering package qualifiers in a query.

Keys are mandatory, but values could also be null if we want to match all
values for a specific key.

NOTE: Before the schema becomes stable, we might change the nulability
requirements of these fields.

types.name: PackageSourceOrArtifact
types.description: PackageSourceOrArtifact is a union of Package, Source, and Artifact.

types.name: PackageSourceOrArtifactInput
types.description:
PackageSourceOrArtifactInput allows using PackageSourceOrArtifact union as
input type to be used in mutations.

Exactly one of the value must be set to non-nil.

types.name: PackageSourceOrArtifactInputs
types.description:
PackageSourceOrArtifactInputs allows using PackageSourceOrArtifact union as
input type to be used in bulk mutations.

Exactly one list must be specified.

types.name: PackageSourceOrArtifactSpec
types.description:
PackageSourceOrArtifactSpec allows using PackageSourceOrArtifact union as
input type to be used in read queries.

Exactly one of the value must be set to non-nil.

types.name: PackageVersion
types.description:
PackageVersion is a package version.

In the pURL representation, each PackageName matches the
pkg:<type>/<namespace>/<name>@<version> pURL.

Versions are optional and each Package type defines own rules for handling
them. For this level of GUAC, these are just opaque strings.

NOTE: The handling of versions might change before this schema becomes stable.

This node can be referred to by other parts of GUAC.

Subpath and qualifiers are optional. Lack of qualifiers is represented by an
empty list and lack of subpath by empty string (to be consistent with
optionality of namespace and version). Two nodes that have different qualifiers
and/or subpath but the same version mean two different packages in the trie
(they are different). Two nodes that have same version but qualifiers of one
are a subset of the qualifier of the other also mean two different packages in
the trie.

types.name: PageInfo
types.description:
PageInfo serves the client information about the paginated query results.

hasNextPage is true when there are results to be returned.

hasPreviousPage is true when there is a previous page to return to.

startCursor is the ID where the query started from.

endCursor is where the query ended.

types.name: PkgEqual
types.description: PkgEqual is an attestation that two packages are similar.

fields.name: packages
fields.description: Two packages that are similar

fields.name: justification
fields.description: Justification for the claim that the packages are similar

fields.name: origin
fields.description: Document from which this attestation is generated from

fields.name: collector
fields.description: GUAC collector for the document

fields.name: documentRef
fields.description: Reference location of the document in the persistent blob store (if that is configured)

types.name: PkgEqualConnection
types.description:
PkgEqualConnection returns the paginated results for PkgEqual.

totalCount is the total number of results returned.

pageInfo provides information to the client if there is
a next page of results and the starting and
ending cursor for the current set.

edges contains the PkgEqualEdge which contains the current cursor
and the PkgEqual node itself

types.name: PkgEqualEdge
types.description:
PkgEqualEdge contains the cursor for the resulting node and
the PkgEqual node itself.

types.name: PkgEqualInputSpec
types.description: PkgEqualInputSpec represents the input to certify that packages are similar.

types.name: PkgEqualSpec
types.description:
PkgEqualSpec allows filtering the list of package equality statements to return
in a query.

Specifying just one package allows to query for all similar packages (if any
exists).

types.name: PkgInputSpec
types.description:
PkgInputSpec specifies a package for mutations.

This is different than PkgSpec because we want to encode mandatory fields:
type and name. All optional fields are given empty default values.

types.name: PkgMatchType
types.description:
PkgMatchType is an enum to determine if the attestation should be done at the
specific version or package name.

types.name: PkgSpec
types.description:
PkgSpec allows filtering the list of sources to return in a query.

Each field matches a qualifier from pURL. Use null to match on all values at
that level. For example, to get all packages in GUAC backend, use a PkgSpec
where every field is null.

The id field can be used to match on a specific node in the trie to match packageTypeID, 
packageNamespaceID, packageNameID, or packageVersionID.

Empty string at a field means matching with the empty string. If passing in
qualifiers, all of the values in the list must match. Since we want to return
nodes with any number of qualifiers if no qualifiers are passed in the input,
we must also return the same set of nodes it the qualifiers list is empty. To
match on nodes that don't contain any qualifier, set matchOnlyEmptyQualifiers
to true. If this field is true, then the qualifiers argument is ignored.

types.name: PointOfContact
types.description:
PointOfContact is an attestation of how to get in touch with the person(s) responsible
for a package, source, or artifact.

All evidence trees record a justification for the property they represent as
well as the document that contains the attestation (origin) and the collector
that collected the document (collector).

The attestation applies to a subject which is a package, source, or artifact.
If the attestation targets a package, it must target a PackageName or a
PackageVersion. If the attestation targets a source, it must target a
SourceName.

email is the email address (singular) of the point of contact.

info is additional contact information other than email address. This is free
form.

NOTE: the identifiers for point of contact should be part of software trees.
This will benefit from identifier look up and traversal as well as organization
hierarchy. However, until the use case arises, PointOfContact will be a flat
reference to the contact details.

fields.name: subject
fields.description: The package, source or artifact that is attested

fields.name: email
fields.description: Email for the POC

fields.name: info
fields.description: Generic info for the POC

fields.name: since
fields.description: Timestamp when the certification for POC was created (in RFC 3339 format)

fields.name: justification
fields.description: The justification for the POC attestation

fields.name: origin
fields.description: Document from which this attestation is generated from

fields.name: collector
fields.description: GUAC collector for the document

fields.name: documentRef
fields.description: Reference location of the document in the persistent blob store (if that is configured)

types.name: PointOfContactConnection
types.description:
PointOfContactConnection returns the paginated results for PointOfContact.

totalCount is the total number of results returned.

pageInfo provides information to the client if there is
a next page of results and the starting and
ending cursor for the current set.

edges contains the PointOfContactEdge which contains the current cursor
and the PointOfContact node itself

types.name: PointOfContactEdge
types.description:
PointOfContactEdge contains the cursor for the resulting node and
the PointOfContact node itself.

types.name: PointOfContactInputSpec
types.description: PointOfContactInputSpec represents the mutation input to ingest a PointOfContact evidence.

types.name: PointOfContactSpec
types.description:
PointOfContactSpec allows filtering the list of PointOfContact evidence to return in a
query.

If a package is specified in the subject filter, then it must be specified up
to PackageName or PackageVersion. That is, user must specify package name, or
name and one of version, qualifiers, or subpath.

If a source is specified in the subject filter, then it must specify a name,
and optionally a tag and a commit.

since filters attestations with a value of since later or equal to the provided filter.

fields.name: artifacts
fields.description: Returns all artifacts matching a filter.

fields.name: artifactsList
fields.description: Returns a paginated results via ArtifactConnection

fields.name: builders
fields.description: Returns all builders matching a filter.

fields.name: buildersList
fields.description: Returns a paginated results via BuilderConnection

fields.name: CertifyBad
fields.description: Returns all CertifyBad attestations matching a filter.

fields.name: CertifyBadList
fields.description: Returns a paginated results via CertifyBadConnection

fields.name: CertifyGood
fields.description: Returns all CertifyGood attestations matching a filter.

fields.name: CertifyGoodList
fields.description: Returns a paginated results via CertifyGoodConnection

fields.name: CertifyLegal
fields.description: Returns all legal certifications matching the input filter.

fields.name: CertifyLegalList
fields.description: Returns a paginated results via CertifyLegalConnection

fields.name: scorecards
fields.description: Returns all Scorecard certifications matching the filter.

fields.name: scorecardsList
fields.description: Returns a paginated results via CertifyScorecardConnection

fields.name: CertifyVEXStatement
fields.description: Returns all VEX certifications matching the input filter.

fields.name: CertifyVEXStatementList
fields.description: Returns a paginated results via CertifyVexConnection

fields.name: CertifyVuln
fields.description: Returns all vulnerability certifications matching the input filter.

fields.name: CertifyVulnList
fields.description: Returns a paginated results via CertifyVulnConnection

fields.name: PointOfContact
fields.description: Returns all PointOfContact attestations matching a filter.

fields.name: PointOfContactList
fields.description: Returns a paginated results via PointOfContactConnection

fields.name: HasSBOM
fields.description: Returns all SBOM certifications.

fields.name: HasSBOMList
fields.description: Returns a paginated results via HasSBOMConnection

fields.name: HasSLSA
fields.description: Returns all SLSA attestations matching the filter.

fields.name: HasSLSAList
fields.description: Returns a paginated results via HasSLSAConnection

fields.name: HasSourceAt
fields.description: Returns all source mappings that match the filter.

fields.name: HasSourceAtList
fields.description: Returns a paginated results via HasSourceAtConnection

fields.name: HashEqual
fields.description: Returns all artifact equality statements matching a filter.

fields.name: HashEqualList
fields.description: Returns a paginated results via HashEqualConnection

fields.name: IsDependency
fields.description: Returns all package dependencies that match the filter.

fields.name: IsDependencyList
fields.description: Returns a paginated results via IsDependencyConnection

fields.name: IsOccurrence
fields.description: Returns all artifacts-source/package mappings that match a filter.

fields.name: IsOccurrenceList
fields.description: Returns a paginated results via IsOccurrenceConnection

fields.name: licenses
fields.description: Returns all licenses matching a filter.

fields.name: licenseList
fields.description: Returns a paginated results via LicenseConnection

fields.name: HasMetadata
fields.description: Returns all HasMetdata attestations matching a filter.

fields.name: HasMetadataList
fields.description: Returns a paginated results via HasMetadataConnection

fields.name: packages
fields.description: Returns all packages matching a filter.

fields.name: packagesList
fields.description: Returns a paginated results via PackageConnection

fields.name: path
fields.description:
path query returns a path between subject and target, of a maximum length.

Since we want to uniquely identify endpoints, nodes must be specified by
valid IDs only (instead of using filters/input spec structs).

Specifying any Edge value in `usingOnly` will make the path only contain the
corresponding GUAC evidence trees (GUAC verbs).

fields.name: neighbors
fields.description:
neighbors returns all the direct neighbors of a node.

Similarly, the input is only specified by its ID.

Specifying any Edge value in `usingOnly` will make the neighbors list only
contain the corresponding GUAC evidence trees (GUAC verbs).

fields.name: neighborsList
fields.description: Returns a paginated results via NeighborConnection

fields.name: node
fields.description:
node returns a single node, regardless of type.

The input is only specified by its ID.

fields.name: nodes
fields.description:
nodes returns an array of nodes, regardless of type.

The input is an array of IDs to retrieve.

fields.name: PkgEqual
fields.description: Returns all package equality statements matching a filter.

fields.name: PkgEqualList
fields.description: Returns a paginated results via PkgEqualConnection

fields.name: findSoftware
fields.description:
findSoftware takes in a searchText string and looks for software
that may be relevant for the input text. This can be seen as fuzzy search
function for Packages, Sources and Artifacts. findSoftware returns a list
of Packages, Sources and Artifacts that it determines to be relevant to
the input searchText.

Due to the nature of full text search being implemented differently on
different db platforms, the behavior of findSoftware is not guaranteed
to be the same. In addition, their statistical nature may result in
results being different per call and not reproducible.

All that is asked in the implementation of this API is that it follows
the spirit of helping to retrieve the right nodes with best effort.

Warning: This is an EXPERIMENTAL feature. This is subject to change.
Warning: This is an OPTIONAL feature. Backends are not required to
implement this API.

fields.name: findSoftwareList
fields.description: Returns a paginated results via CertifyBadConnection

fields.name: findTopLevelPackagesRelatedToVulnerability
fields.description:
findTopLevelPackagesRelatedToVulnerability takes in a vulnerabilityID string
and looks for top level packages (i.e. packages with an SBOM) related to the
corresponding vulnerability. findTopLevelPackagesRelatedToVulnerability
returns a list of Nodes, representing the path from the certify vulnerability
to a top level package.

All that is asked in the implementation of this API is that it follows
the spirit of helping to retrieve the right nodes with best effort.

Warning: This is an EXPERIMENTAL feature. This is subject to change.
Warning: This is an OPTIONAL feature. Backends are not required to
implement this API.

fields.name: findVulnerability
fields.description: Returns all vulnerabilities related to a package.

fields.name: findVulnerabilityByCPE
fields.description: Returns all vulnerabilities related to the package identified by the CPE

fields.name: findVulnerabilityBySbomURI
fields.description: Returns all vulnerabilities related to the package identified by the SBOM URI

fields.name: findDependentProduct
fields.description: Returns all top level packages (i.e. products) dependent on the input PURL package

fields.name: sources
fields.description: Returns all sources matching a filter.

fields.name: sourcesList
fields.description: Returns a paginated results via SourceConnection

fields.name: vulnEqual
fields.description: Returns all equal vulnerability mappings that match a filter.

fields.name: vulnEqualList
fields.description: Returns a paginated results via VulnEqualConnection

fields.name: vulnerabilityMetadata
fields.description: Returns all vulnerabilityMetadata attestations matching a filter.

fields.name: vulnerabilityMetadataList
fields.description: Returns a paginated results via VulnerabilityMetadataConnection

fields.name: vulnerabilities
fields.description: Returns all vulnerabilities matching a filter.

fields.name: vulnerabilityList
fields.description: Returns a paginated results via VulnerabilityConnection

types.name: SLSA
types.description:
SLSA contains all of the fields present in a SLSA attestation.

The materials and builders are objects of the HasSLSA predicate, everything
else are properties extracted from the attestation.

We also include fields to specify under what conditions the check was performed
(time of scan, version of scanners, etc.) as well as how this information got
included into GUAC (origin document and the collector for that document).

fields.name: builtFrom
fields.description: Materials of the build resulting in subject

fields.name: builtBy
fields.description: Builder performing the build

fields.name: buildType
fields.description: Type of the builder

fields.name: slsaPredicate
fields.description: Individual predicates found in the attestation

fields.name: slsaVersion
fields.description: Version of the SLSA predicate

fields.name: startedOn
fields.description: Timestamp (RFC3339Nano format) of build start time

fields.name: finishedOn
fields.description: Timestamp (RFC3339Nano format) of build end time

fields.name: origin
fields.description: Document from which this attestation is generated from

fields.name: collector
fields.description: GUAC collector for the document

fields.name: documentRef
fields.description: Reference location of the document in the persistent blob store (if that is configured)

types.name: SLSAInputSpec
types.description: SLSAInputSpec is the same as SLSA but for mutation input.

types.name: SLSAPredicate
SLSAPredicateInputSpec
types.description: SLSAPredicateInputSpec allows ingesting SLSAPredicateSpec.

types.name: SLSAPredicateSpec
types.description: SLSAPredicateSpec is the same as SLSAPredicate, but usable as query input.

types.name: ScanMetadata
types.description:
ScanMetadata is the metadata attached to vulnerability certification.

It contains metadata about the scanner process that created the certification.

fields.name: timeScanned
fields.description: Time of scan (in RFC 3339 format)

fields.name: dbUri
fields.description: URI of the vulnerability database used by the scanner

fields.name: dbVersion
fields.description: Version of the vulnerability database used by the scanner

fields.name: scannerUri
fields.description: URI of the scanner

fields.name: scannerVersion
fields.description: Version of the scanner

fields.name: origin
fields.description: Document from which this attestation is generated from

fields.name: collector
fields.description: GUAC collector for the document

fields.name: documentRef
fields.description: Reference location of the document in the persistent blob store (if that is configured)

types.name: ScanMetadataInput
types.description:
ScanMetadataInput represents the input for certifying vulnerability
scans in mutations.

types.name: Scorecard
types.description:
Scorecard contains all of the fields present in a Scorecard attestation.

We also include fields to specify under what conditions the check was performed
(time of scan, version of scanners, etc.) as well as how this information got
included into GUAC (origin document and the collector for that document).

fields.name: checks
fields.description: Individual Scorecard check scores (Branch-Protection, Code-Review, ...)

fields.name: aggregateScore
fields.description: Overall Scorecard score for the source

fields.name: timeScanned
fields.description: Exact timestamp when the source was last scanned (in RFC 3339 format)

fields.name: scorecardVersion
fields.description: Version of the Scorecard scanner used to analyze the source

fields.name: scorecardCommit
fields.description: Commit of the Scorecards repository at the time of scanning the source

fields.name: origin
fields.description: Document from which this attestation is generated from

fields.name: collector
fields.description: GUAC collector for the document

fields.name: documentRef
fields.description: Reference location of the document in the persistent blob store (if that is configured)

types.name: ScorecardCheck
types.description:
ScorecardCheck are the individual checks from scorecard and their values as a
key-value pair.

For example:  Branch-Protection, Code-Review...etc

Based off scorecard's:
type jsonCheckResultV2 struct {
  Details []string                 `json:"details"`
  Score   int                      `json:"score"`
  Reason  string                   `json:"reason"`
  Name    string                   `json:"name"`
  Doc     jsonCheckDocumentationV2 `json:"documentation"`
}
This node cannot be directly referred by other parts of GUAC.

types.name: ScorecardCheckInputSpec
types.description: ScorecardCheckInputSpec represents the mutation input for a Scorecard check.

types.name: ScorecardCheckSpec
types.description: ScorecardCheckSpec is the same as ScorecardCheck, but usable as query input.

types.name: ScorecardInputSpec
types.description: ScorecardInputSpec represents the mutation input to ingest a Scorecard.

types.name: SoftwareEdge
types.description:
SoftwareEdge contains the cursor for the resulting node and
the PackageSourceOrArtifact node itself.

types.name: Source
types.description:
Source represents the root of the source trie/tree.

We map source information to a trie, as a derivative of the pURL specification:
each path in the trie represents a type, namespace, name and an optional
qualifier that stands for tag/commit information.

This node represents the type part of the trie path. It is used to represent
the version control system that is being used.

Since this node is at the root of the source trie, it is named Source, not
SourceType.

types.name: SourceConnection
types.description:
SourceConnection returns the paginated results for Source.

totalCount is the total number of results returned.

pageInfo provides information to the client if there is
a next page of results and the starting and
ending cursor for the current set.

edges contains the SourceEdge which contains the current cursor
and the Source node itself

types.name: SourceEdge
types.description:
SourceEdge contains the cursor for the resulting node and
the Source node itself.

types.name: SourceIDs
types.description: The IDs of the ingested source

types.name: SourceInputSpec
types.description:
SourceInputSpec specifies a source for mutations.

This is different than SourceSpec because we want to encode that all fields
except tag and commit are mandatory fields. All optional fields are given empty
default values.

It is an error to set both tag and commit fields to values different than the
default.

types.name: SourceName
types.description:
SourceName represents the url of the repository.

The name field is mandatory. The tag and commit fields are optional, but it is
an error to specify both.

This is the only source trie node that can be referenced by other parts of GUAC.

types.name: SourceNamespace
types.description:
SourceNamespace is a namespace for sources.

This is the location of the repository (such as github/gitlab/bitbucket).

The namespace field is mandatory.

types.name: SourceSpec
types.description:
SourceSpec allows filtering the list of sources to return in a query.

Empty string at a field means matching with the empty string. Missing field
means retrieving all possible matches.

It is an error to specify both tag and commit fields, except it both are set as
empty string (in which case the returned sources are only those for which there
is no tag/commit information).

types.name: String
types.description: The `String`scalar type represents textual data, represented as UTF-8 character sequences. The String type is most often used by GraphQL to represent free-form human-readable text.

types.name: Time
types.description:
Define the Time scalar, to be used across GUAC. It follows RFC3339Nano format.

This is implicit via https://gqlgen.com/reference/scalars/#time

For GUAC, we assume that all times are stored in UTC format.

types.name: VEXConnection
types.description:
VEXConnection returns the paginated results for CertifyVEXStatement.

totalCount is the total number of results returned.

pageInfo provides information to the client if there is
a next page of results and the starting and
ending cursor for the current set.

edges contains the VEXEdge which contains the current cursor
and the CertifyVEXStatement node itself

types.name: VEXEdge
types.description:
VEXEdge contains the cursor for the resulting node and
the CertifyVEXStatement node itself.

types.name: VexJustification
types.description: Records the justification included in the VEX statement.

types.name: VexStatementInputSpec
types.description: VexStatementInputSpec represents the input to ingest VEX statements.

types.name: VexStatus
types.description: Records the status of a VEX statement subject.

types.name: VulnEqual
types.description:
VulnEqual is an attestation to link two vulnerabilities together as being equal"

Note that setting noVuln vulnerability type is invalid for VulnEqual!

fields.name: vulnerabilities
fields.description: Two vulnerabilities that are similar

fields.name: justification
fields.description: Justification for the attested relationship

fields.name: origin
fields.description: Document from which this attestation is generated from

fields.name: collector
fields.description: GUAC collector for the document

fields.name: documentRef
fields.description: Reference location of the document in the persistent blob store (if that is configured)

types.name: VulnEqualConnection
types.description:
VulnEqualConnection returns the paginated results for VulnEqual.

totalCount is the total number of results returned.

pageInfo provides information to the client if there is
a next page of results and the starting and
ending cursor for the current set.

edges contains the VulnEqualEdge which contains the current cursor
and the VulnEqual node itself

types.name: VulnEqualEdge
types.description:
VulnEqualEdge contains the cursor for the resulting node and
the VulnEqual node itself.

types.name: VulnEqualInputSpec
types.description: VulnEqualInputSpec represents the input to link vulnerabilities to each other.

types.name: VulnEqualSpec
types.description:
VulnEqualSpec allows filtering the list of vulnerability links to return
in a query.

types.name: Vulnerability
types.description:
Vulnerability represents the root of the vulnerability trie/tree.

We map vulnerability information to a trie, as a derivative of the pURL specification:
each path in the trie represents a type and a vulnerability ID. This allows for generic
representation of the various vulnerabilities and does not limit to just cve, ghsa or osv.
This would be in the general format: vuln://<general-type>/<vuln-id>

Examples:

CVE, using path separator: vuln://cve/cve-2023-20753
OSV, representing its knowledge of a GHSA: vuln://osv/ghsa-205hk
Random vendor: vuln://snyk/sn-whatever
NoVuln: vuln://novuln/


This node represents the type part of the trie path. It is used to represent
the specific type of the vulnerability: cve, ghsa, osv or some other vendor specific

Since this node is at the root of the vulnerability trie, it is named Vulnerability, not
VulnerabilityType.

NoVuln is a special vulnerability node to attest that no vulnerability has been
found during a vulnerability scan. It will have the type "novuln" and contain an empty string
for vulnerabilityID

The resolvers will enforce that both the type and vulnerability IDs are lower case.

types.name: VulnerabilityConnection
types.description:
VulnerabilityConnection returns the paginated results for Vulnerability.

totalCount is the total number of results returned.

pageInfo provides information to the client if there is
a next page of results and the starting and
ending cursor for the current set.

edges contains the VulnerabilityEdge which contains the current cursor
and the Vulnerability node itself

types.name: VulnerabilityEdge
types.description:
VulnerabilityEdge contains the cursor for the resulting node and
the Vulnerability node itself.

types.name: VulnerabilityID
types.description:
VulnerabilityID is a specific vulnerability ID associated with the type of the vulnerability.

This will be enforced to be all lowercase.

The namespace field is mandatory.

types.name: VulnerabilityIDs
types.description: The IDs of the ingested vulnerability

types.name: VulnerabilityInputSpec
types.description:
VulnInputSpec specifies a vulnerability for mutations.

This is different than VulnSpec because we want to encode mandatory fields:
type and vulnerabilityID.

types.name: VulnerabilityMetadata
types.description:
VulnerabilityMetadata is an attestation that a vulnerability has a related score
associated with it.

The intent of this evidence tree predicate is to allow extensibility of vulnerability
score (one-to-one mapping) with a specific vulnerability ID.

A vulnerability ID can have a one-to-many relationship with the VulnerabilityMetadata
node as a vulnerability ID can have multiple scores (in various frameworks).

Examples:

scoreType: EPSSv1
scoreValue: 0.960760000

scoreType: CVSSv2
scoreValue: 5.0

scoreType: CVSSv3
scoreValue: 7.5

The timestamp is used to determine when the score was evaluated for the specific vulnerability.

fields.name: vulnerability
fields.description: The subject vulnerability that the metadata applies to

fields.name: scoreType
fields.description: The specific score type for the score value

fields.name: scoreValue
fields.description: The score value based on the score type

fields.name: timestamp
fields.description: Timestamp when the certification was created (in RFC 3339 format)

fields.name: origin
fields.description: Document from which this attestation is generated from

fields.name: collector
fields.description: GUAC collector for the document

fields.name: documentRef
fields.description: Reference location of the document in the persistent blob store (if that is configured)

types.name: VulnerabilityMetadataConnection
types.description:
VulnerabilityMetadataConnection returns the paginated results for VulnerabilityMetadata.

totalCount is the total number of results returned.

pageInfo provides information to the client if there is
a next page of results and the starting and
ending cursor for the current set.

edges contains the VulnerabilityMetadataEdge which contains the current cursor
and the VulnerabilityMetadata node itself

types.name: VulnerabilityMetadataEdge
types.description:
VulnerabilityMetadataEdge contains the cursor for the resulting node and
the VulnerabilityMetadata node itself.

types.name: VulnerabilityMetadataInputSpec
types.description: VulnerabilityMetadataInputSpec represents the mutation input to ingest a vulnerability metadata.

types.name: VulnerabilityMetadataSpec
types.description:
VulnerabilityMetadataSpec allows filtering the list of VulnerabilityMetadata evidence 
to return in a query.

Comparator field is an enum that be set to filter the score and return a
range that matches. If the comparator is not specified, it will default to equal operation.

Timestamp specified indicates filtering timestamps after the specified time

types.name: VulnerabilityScoreType
types.description: Records the type of the score being captured by the score node

types.name: VulnerabilitySpec
types.description:
VulnerabilitySpec allows filtering the list of vulnerabilities to return in a query.

Use null to match on all values at that level.
For example, to get all vulnerabilities in GUAC backend, use a VulnSpec
where every field is null.

Setting the noVuln boolean true will ignore the other inputs for type and vulnerabilityID.
Setting noVuln to true means retrieving only nodes where the type of the vulnerability is "novuln"
and the it has an empty string for vulnerabilityID. Setting it to false filters out all results that are "novuln".
Setting one of the other fields and omitting the noVuln means retrieving vulnerabilities for the corresponding
type and vulnerabilityID. Omission of noVuln field will return all vulnerabilities and novuln.

directives.name: defer
directives.description: The @defer directive may be specified on a fragment spread to imply de-prioritization, that causes the fragment to be omitted in the initial response, and delivered as a subsequent response afterward. A query with @defer directive will cause the request to potentially return multiple responses, where non-deferred data is delivered in the initial response and data deferred delivered in a subsequent response. @include and @skip take precedence over @defer.

directives.name: deprecated
directives.description: The @deprecated built-in directive is used within the type system definition language to indicate deprecated portions of a GraphQL service's schema, such as deprecated fields on a type, arguments on a field, input fields on an input type, or values of an enum type.

directives.name: include
directives.description: The @include directive may be provided for fields, fragment spreads, and inline fragments, and allows for conditional inclusion during execution as described by the if argument.

directives.name: skip
directives.description: The @skip directive may be provided for fields, fragment spreads, and inline fragments, and allows for conditional exclusion during execution as described by the if argument.

directives.name: specifiedBy
directives.description: The @specifiedBy built-in directive is used within the type system definition language to provide a scalar specification URL for specifying the behavior of custom scalar types.
